metadata.synopsis: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

11.speaker: Mayrina
11.text: You bastard! You ruined it - you ruined everything!
11.context: NodeContext: You are SPITTING angry - the player has ruined your deal with ethel - you will NEVER see your husband again now

25.speaker: Mayrina
25.text: First my brothers and now my husband? What more do you want?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Slow down - what did I do?

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I'm sorry. I was trying to help.

97.speaker: Mayrina
97.context: NodeContext: Utterly furious that the player has the GALL to apologise

35.speaker: Player
35.text: This is an interesting way of thanking me.

89.speaker: Mayrina
89.text: You want thanks? A slap is all you deserve.
89.context: NodeContext: Utterly furious that the player has the GALL to expect thanks

118.speaker: Mayrina
118.text: Ethel was going to bring my husband back. Back from the dead! And now I'll never see him again - because of you.
118.context: NodeContext: Your anger isn't as explosive as you've settled into a quiet rage but you are still FURIOUS at the player for interfering

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Because of Auntie Ethel. You nearly died!

32.speaker: Mayrina
32.text: I was fine. She wouldn't have killed me - I had something she wanted.
32.context: NodeContext: "something she wanted": Mayrina places hands on pregnant stomach

111.speaker: Mayrina
111.text: Just a bit longer and my child would have been born. And all this - all this would have been over.
111.context: NodeContext: Your voice breaks a bit at the end here. You were in a lot of pain with the hag and suffering, your wall is crumbling a touch

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You were going to trade your baby for your dead husband?

31.speaker: Mayrina
31.text: Don't judge me. I have nothing. My baby would have been raised in rags.
31.context: NodeContext: Cold fury - the player is getting on your nerves

22.speaker: Mayrina
22.text: Auntie Ethel promised to give this child a good life - teach them magic, even!
22.context: NodeContext: All you wanted was your child happy and your husband home.

66.speaker: Mayrina
66.text: More than I could have done...
66.context: NodeContext: You feel like a 'bad mother' -something ethel repeated to you over and over

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Is that what Ethel told you?

45.speaker: Mayrina
45.text: She said I'd make a bad mother. I... I think she was right.
45.context: NodeContext: close to tears, player has hit the nail on the head,

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Don't sell yourself short. You can raise this child.

37.speaker: Mayrina
37.text: I always wanted to be a mother. I... just never thought I'd do it alone.
37.context: NodeContext: Miserable as the reality of your situation sinks in

108.speaker: Player
108.text: From what I've seen, you'd make a terrible mother.

9.speaker: Mayrina
9.text: I... I think you're right. That's what Ethel always told me.
9.context: NodeContext: close to tears, player has hit the nail on the head,

112.speaker: Mayrina
112.text: Now I'll have to drag Connor's coffin all the way home. It's the only way this child will ever meet their father.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You should have known better - hags don't help anyone but themselves.

107.speaker: Mayrina
107.text: Well, I didn't bloody ask you, did I? I didn't ask for any of this! I just wanted Connor back.
107.context: NodeContext: You feel like the player isn't listening to you and is just judging you like everyone else - when all you're trying to do is the best you can

70.speaker: Player
70.text: With hags, nothing is ever over.

119.speaker: Mayrina
119.text: This was the best chance I had - for me and my baby.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: A life for a life - you must really love your husband.

76.speaker: Mayrina
76.context: NodeContext: Hands on stomach - love and sadness at the mention of both

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Don't be naive - a hag was never going to help you.

54.speaker: Mayrina
54.text: She would've! I had everything figured out.
54.context: NodeContext: "everything figured out": Mayrina places hands on pregnant stomach

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Hags don't work for free. What did you promise her?

81.speaker: Mayrina
81.context: NodeContext: Mayrina places hands on pregnant stomach

80.speaker: Mayrina
80.text: No, I'm not! Why ruin my deal when I was so close?
80.context: NodeContext: "so close": Mayrina places hands on pregnant stomach

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Auntie Ethel planned to eat your child.

91.speaker: Mayrina
91.text: What? But she promised to look after them! Teach them magic!
91.context: NodeContext: Player has revealed that ethel planned to eat your child. Gut wrenching shock and horror

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm sorry - she lied to you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I mean - turning a child into a hag does involve teaching them magic...

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You're an idiot for believing that.

100.speaker: Mayrina
100.text: ... I'm so stupid. So bloody stupid.
100.context: NodeContext: Immediately turning to blame yourself. Feeling like you can't do anything right.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: No, you were desperate. And she took advantage of that.

78.speaker: Mayrina
78.text: I thought I could fix it. Give my child a good home and bring my husband back - all in one go.
78.context: NodeContext: Getting upset as you tell your story, thinking of how close you were to getting the love of your life back

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I'm sorry. You've been through a lot.

47.speaker: Mayrina
47.text: People always say that. It doesn't mean anything.
47.context: NodeContext: The grief filled determination of someone who has seen too much

104.speaker: Mayrina
104.text: I'm done. With you, with this place. After everything I went through to get Connor back.
104.context: NodeContext: Angry and upset - tears can't be held back anymore

116.speaker: Mayrina
116.text: Now I have to drag his corpse back home, coffin and all, because a goddamn grave is the closest I'll get to seeing him again.

5.speaker: Mayrina
5.context: NodeContext: Your parting words to the player - you're bitter and angry with them. To you, they took away the last chance you have of ever seeing your husband.

109.speaker: Mayrina
109.text: Look, I - I don't have much...
109.context: NodeContext: You're getting upset, about to give a locket to the player - it's all you have left of your husband - because you feel you owe them.

55.speaker: Mayrina
55.text: ...but take this locket. It's worth a bit. Now we're even.
55.context: NodeContext: Fighting back tears as you try to act businesslike but failing.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Not much indeed. Got nothing else?

64.speaker: Mayrina
64.text: It's this or the clothes off my back - and I'm not walking out of here starkers. You want it or not?
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still holding out locket.NodeContext: A note of steel in your voice - this locket means everything to you. Still holding out locket.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Keep it. You don't owe me anything.

61.speaker: Mayrina
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutches locket close, then pockets it.NodeContext: At end of line, clutch locket close to your chest then pocket it. You're surprised but delighted. The locket was made for you by your husband - it's all you have.

56.speaker: Mayrina
56.text: Just look after it, all right?
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pockets locket.NodeContext: Look away - trying to keep the grief at losing the necklace out of your voice.

2.speaker: Mayrina
2.text: My husband gave it to me. I should take him home.
2.context: NodeContext: beat between sentences, sadness as you think of your husband but steeling yourself for what comes next

7.speaker: Mayrina
7.text: His coffin is just upstairs. A decent burial is the least I can give him.
7.context: NodeContext: Your voice almost breaks but you're holding it together.

0.speaker: Mayrina
0.text: Thank you. I don't think there's anyone else who would've saved me.
0.context: NodeContext: Sad but truly grateful. Sound a little hesitant - you don't think you deserved saving

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Now is the time to focus on your child.

28.speaker: Mayrina
28.text: You think my baby ever left my mind? Not even at my lowest.
28.context: NodeContext: The grief filled determination of someone who has seen too much

113.speaker: Player
113.text: It was obviously too good to be true.

33.speaker: Mayrina
33.context: NodeContext: The grief filled determination of someone who has seen too much

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I don't need this. Good luck getting out of here on your own.

20.speaker: Mayrina
20.text: Go on. Walk away. And wave to my husband's rotting corpse on your way out.

27.speaker: Mayrina
27.text: That's right - he's buried outside. And I was this close to getting him back.

79.speaker: Mayrina
79.text: Thanks to you, I'll never see him again.

13.speaker: Mayrina
13.text: I'm so stupid. How could I have trusted her?
13.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

21.speaker: Mayrina
21.text: I almost gave that monster my child.
21.context: NodeContext: The true horror of what you almost did is dawning on you - giving your child to a hag.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Why the hells would you even consider that?

106.speaker: Mayrina
106.text: That's what she wanted - my baby. And, gods, I was going to do it - for him.
106.context: NodeContext: Horror and grief as you recount your deal

77.speaker: Mayrina
77.text: It was part of the deal. For him.
77.context: NodeContext: Horror and grief as you recount your deal

19.speaker: Mayrina
19.text: My husband. She was going to bring him back. Bring Connor back to life.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Your husband must have meant a great deal to you.

71.speaker: Mayrina
71.text: Connor would have done anything to save me - I had to do the same.

73.speaker: Mayrina
73.text: I just wanted everything back - back the way it was.
73.context: NodeContext: Crying, covering your face in your hands - you hate crying in front of others but this is you at your lowest

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Ethel saw you were vulnerable. She took advantage.

36.speaker: Mayrina
36.text: It's my own fault for letting her.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: That doesn't excuse the deal you made.

96.speaker: Mayrina
96.text: I never said it did! I just wanted you to understand.

88.speaker: Mayrina
88.text: I imagine Ethel thinks the same.
88.context: NodeContext: Not meeting the player's eye, thinking of all the harsh things you endured under Ethel

43.speaker: Mayrina
43.text: I imagine Ethel would've said the same.
43.context: NodeContext: Not meeting the player's eye, thinking of all the harsh things you endured under Ethel

52.speaker: Mayrina
52.text: She always told me I was worthless.
52.context: NodeContext: Not meeting the player's eye, thinking of all the harsh things you endured under Ethel

44.speaker: Mayrina
44.text: Look - I don't like owing people.
44.context: NodeContext: Dejected but pulling yourself together. You're a fighter, and you'll keep on fighting

115.speaker: Mayrina
115.text: Here. This locket is worth some coin.
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Produces a small gold locket held in her palm and holds it out to the player.NodeContext: Greving  but determined - Produces a small gold locket held in her palm and holds it out to the player.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: What would have happened to your child?

110.speaker: Mayrina
110.text: Ethel promised to raise the child - teach them magic. Give them a good life. That's a damn sight better than I can do.
110.context: NodeContext: You made this deal with child in mind. You will NOT be judged for wanting your child to have a better life.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You'd have sacrificed a new life for a lost life? Pure selfishness.

95.speaker: Mayrina
95.context: NodeContext: Getting defensive and angry - you will not be judged by someone

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Let me know when you're done whining.

98.speaker: Mayrina
98.text: I'm more the fool for getting upset. It's likely gold you want, right?
98.context: NodeContext: Resigned, bitter - you're feeling lost and alone

17.speaker: Mayrina
17.context: NodeContext: Struggling to pull yourself together - but managing. If the player doesn't want to hear about how upset you are, you have too much pride to continue talking about the child/deal.

65.speaker: Mayrina
65.text: Ethel's gone, isn't she? I felt it.
65.context: NodeContext: Scared and horrified - the reality of what almost happened sinking in.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Yes. She's left this place for good.

92.speaker: Mayrina
92.text: I can't believe I was so stupid.
92.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

24.speaker: Mayrina
24.text: Awake or asleep I could hear her. Laughing at me. Taunting me. Now it's gone.
